SEARCH
Package ca.openosp.openo.ckd

Interface Excludes

All Superinterfaces:
org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject, org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlTokenSource
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExcludesImpl
public interface Excludes extends org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject
CKD exclusion criteria configuration interface. Defines the contract for managing exclusion criteria within the Chronic Kidney Disease clinical decision support system. This interface allows configuration of conditions, diagnoses, or other clinical parameters that should exclude patients from specific CKD screening protocols, monitoring guidelines, or treatment recommendations. Common exclusion criteria might include: - Terminal illness diagnoses - Dialysis or kidney transplant status - Pregnancy - Age-related exclusions - Specific medication contraindications The interface extends XMLBeans XmlObject to provide comprehensive XML serialization and deserialization capabilities for integration with EMR configuration systems.
Since:
2010-01-01

  • Method Details

    • getExcludeArray

      String[] getExcludeArray()
      Retrieves the complete array of exclusion criteria strings.
      Returns:
      String[] array containing all configured exclusion criteria, may be empty but never null

    • getExcludeArray

      String getExcludeArray(int index)
      Retrieves a specific exclusion criterion by array index.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the exclusion criterion to retrieve
      Returns:
      String the exclusion criterion at the specified index
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • xgetExcludeArray

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString[] xgetExcludeArray()
      Retrieves the complete array of exclusion criteria as XMLBeans XmlString objects. This method provides access to the underlying XMLBeans representation, preserving XML schema type information and validation capabilities.
      Returns:
      XmlString[] array of XMLBeans string objects containing exclusion criteria

    • xgetExcludeArray

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString xgetExcludeArray(int index)
      Retrieves a specific exclusion criterion as an XMLBeans XmlString object.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the exclusion criterion
      Returns:
      XmlString XMLBeans object preserving type and validation information
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • sizeOfExcludeArray

      int sizeOfExcludeArray()
      Returns the total number of configured exclusion criteria.
      Returns:
      int count of exclusion criteria in the array (0 or greater)

    • setExcludeArray

      void setExcludeArray(String[] excludes)
      Replaces the entire exclusion criteria array with new values. This method overwrites all existing exclusion criteria with the provided array. Use with caution as it will remove any previously configured exclusions.
      Parameters:
      excludes - String[] new array of exclusion criteria to set

    • setExcludeArray

      void setExcludeArray(int index, String exclude)
      Updates a specific exclusion criterion at the given array index.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the exclusion criterion to update
      exclude - String new exclusion criterion value
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • xsetExcludeArray

      void xsetExcludeArray(org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString[] excludes)
      Replaces the entire exclusion criteria array using XMLBeans XmlString objects. This method allows setting exclusion criteria while preserving XML schema type information and validation capabilities.
      Parameters:
      excludes - XmlString[] array of XMLBeans string objects

    • xsetExcludeArray

      void xsetExcludeArray(int index, org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString exclude)
      Updates a specific exclusion criterion using an XMLBeans XmlString object.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the exclusion criterion to update
      exclude - XmlString XMLBeans object with type and validation information
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • insertExclude

      void insertExclude(int index, String exclude)
      Inserts a new exclusion criterion at the specified array position. All existing exclusion criteria at and after the specified index will be shifted one position to the right. The array size will increase by one.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based insertion position
      exclude - String exclusion criterion to insert

    • addExclude

      void addExclude(String exclude)
      Appends a new exclusion criterion to the end of the array. This is the most common method for adding new exclusion criteria to the CKD configuration. The new criterion will be added at the end of the existing array.
      Parameters:
      exclude - String exclusion criterion to add

    • insertNewExclude

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString insertNewExclude(int index)
      Inserts a new empty XMLBeans XmlString exclusion criterion at the specified position. Creates and inserts a new XMLBeans XmlString object that can be populated with exclusion criterion data while preserving XML schema validation.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based insertion position
      Returns:
      XmlString newly created XMLBeans object for population

    • addNewExclude

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString addNewExclude()
      Appends a new empty XMLBeans XmlString exclusion criterion to the array. Creates and adds a new XMLBeans XmlString object at the end of the array that can be populated with exclusion criterion data.
      Returns:
      XmlString newly created XMLBeans object for population

    • removeExclude

      void removeExclude(int index)
      Removes an exclusion criterion at the specified array index. All exclusion criteria after the removed element will be shifted one position to the left. The array size will decrease by one.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the exclusion criterion to remove
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid
